lines.line_text: HERE interposing, as the GODDESS paus'd, —
"Oh blest BRITANNIA! in THY Presence blest,
" THOU Guardian of Mankind! whence spring, alone,
"All human Grandeur, Happiness and Fame:
" For Toil, by THEE protected, feels no Pain;
"The poor Man's Lot with Milk and Honey flows;
" And, gilded with Thy Rays, even Death looks gay.
"Let other Lands the potent Blessings boast
" Of more exalting Suns. Let  Woods,
"Untended, yield the vegetable Fleece:
" And let the little Insect-Artist form,
"On higher Life intent, it's silken Tomb.
" Let wondering Rocks, in radiant Birth, disclose,
"The various-tinctur'd Children of the Sun.
" From the prone Beam let more delicious Fruits
"A Flavour drink, that in one piercing Taste
" Bids each combine. Let  Vineyards burst
"With Floods of Joy, with mild balsamic Juice
" The  Olive. Let  breathe
"Her spicy Gales, her vital Gums distill.
" Turbid with Gold, let  Rivers flow;
"And  Floods draw soft, o'er Pearls, their Maze.
" Let  vaunt her Treasures; let
"Deep in her Bowels her own Ruin breed,
" The yellow Traitor that her Bliss betray'd, —
"Unequall'd Bliss! — and to unequall'd Rage!
" Yet nor the gorgeous  nor golden
"Nor, in full Prime, that
" Where flames the falling Day, in Wealth and Praise,
"Shall with BRITANNIA vie, while, GODDESS, she
" Derives her Praise from  her matchless Charms.
"Her hearty Fruits the Hand of  own;
" And, warm with Culture, her thick-clustering Fields
"Prolific teem. Eternal Verdure crowns
" Her Meads; her Gardens smile eternal Spring.
"She gives the Hunter-Horse, unquell'd by Toil,
" Ardent, to rush into the rapid Chace:
"She, whitening o'er her Downs, diffusive, pours
" Unnumber'd Flocks: She weaves the fleecy Robe,
"That wraps the Nations: She, to lusty Droves,
" The richest Pasture spreads; and Her's deep-wave
"Autumnal Seas of pleasing Plenty round.
" These her Delights: And by no baneful Herb,
"No darting Tyger, no grim Lion's Glare,
" No fierce-descending Wolf, no Serpent roll'd
"In Spires immense progressive o'er the Land,
" Disturb'd. Enlivening These, add Cities, full
"Of Wealth, of Trade, of chearful toiling Crowds:
" Add thriving Towns: add Villages and Farms,
"Innumerous fow'd along the lively Vale,
" Where bold unrival'd Peasants happy dwell:
"Add ancient Seats, with venerable Oaks
" Embosom'd high, while kindred Floods below
"Wind thro' the Mead; and Those of modern Hand,
" More pompous, add, that splendid shine afar:
"Need I her limpid Lakes, her Rivers name,
" Where swarm the finny Race? Thee, chief, O
"On whose each Tide, glad with returning Sails,
" Flows in the mingled Harvest of Mankind?
"And thee, thou  whose prodigious Swell,
" And Waves, resounding, imitate the Main?
"Why need I name her deep capacious Ports,
" That point around the World? And why her Seas?
"All Ocean is her own, and every Land
" To whom her ruling Thunder Ocean bears.
"She too the Mineral feeds: th' obedient Lead,
" The Warrior-Iron, nor the Peaceful less,
"Forming of Life art-civiliz'd the Bond;
" And  the  Merchant sought of old,
"Not dreaming then of BRITAIN's brighter Fame.
" She rears to  an undaunted Race:
"Compatriot zealous, hospitable, kind,
" Her's the warm CAMBRIAN: Her's the lofty SCOT,
"To Hardship tam'd, active in Arts and Arms,
" Fir'd with a restless an impatient Flame,
"That leads him raptur'd where Ambition calls:
" And ENGLISH MERIT Her's; where meet, combin'd,
"Whate'er high Fancy, sound judicious Thought,
" An ample generous Heart, undrooping Soul,
"And firm tenacious Valour can bestow.
" Great Nurse of Fruits, of Flocks, of Commerce, SHE!
"Great Nurse of Men! by THEE, O GODDESS, taught,
" Her old Renown I trace, disclose her Source
"Of Wealth, of Grandeur, and to BRITONS sing
" A Strain the  never touch'd before. "

lines.line_text: " THY  KINGDOM

stanzas.stanza_text:
" THY  KINGDOM
"  "

lines.line_text: At this HER Eye, collecting all it's Fire,
Beam'd more than human; and HER awful Voice,
Majestic, thus SHE rais'd — "To BRITONS bear
" This closing Strain, and with intenser Note
"Loud let it sound in their awaken'd Ear."

stanzas.stanza_text:
At this HER Eye, collecting all it's Fire,
Beam'd more than human; and HER awful Voice,
Majestic, thus SHE rais'd — "To BRITONS bear
" This closing Strain, and with intenser Note
"Loud let it sound in their awaken'd Ear."

lines.line_text: VIRTUE  MY KINGDOM
PUBLICK VIRTUE, EVERY VIRTUE JOIN'D.
For, lost this social Cement of Mankind,
The greatest Empires, by scarce-felt Degrees,
Will moulder soft away; 'till, tottering loose,
They prone at last to total Ruin rush.
Unblest by VIRTUE,  a
Becomes, a
To rob by Law;  mild a
To tame the stooping Soul, a
To mask their Rapine, and to share the Prey.
What are without IT  save a Face
Of Consultation deep and Reason free,
While the determin'd Voice and Heart are sold?
What boasted  save a sounding Name?
And what  but a Market vile
Of Slaves self-barter'd? VIRTUE! without THEE,
There is no ruling Eye, no Nerve, in States;
War has no Vigour, and no Safety Peace:
Even Justice warps to Party, Laws oppress,
Wide thro' the Land their weak Protection fails,
First broke the Ballance, and then scorn'd the Sword.
Thus Nations sink, Society dissolves;
Rapine and Guile and Violence break loose,
Everting Life, and turning Love to Gall;
Man hates the Face of Man, and  Woods
And  hissing Sands to him are tame.

And  hissing Sands to him are tame.

lines.line_text: By those THREE VIRTUES be the Frame sustain'd,
Of BRITISH FREEDOM: INDEPENDENT LIFE;
INTEGRITY IN OFFICE; and, o'er all
Supreme, A PASSION FOR THE COMMON-WEAL.

stanzas.stanza_text:
By those THREE VIRTUES be the Frame sustain'd,
Of BRITISH FREEDOM: INDEPENDENT LIFE;
INTEGRITY IN OFFICE; and, o'er all
Supreme, A PASSION FOR THE COMMON-WEAL.

lines.line_text: Hail! INDEPENDANCE, hail! HEAVEN's next best Gift,
To that of Life and an immortal Soul!
The Life of Life! that to the Banquet high
And sober Meal gives taste; to the bow'd Roof
Fair-dream'd Repose, and to the Cottage Charms.
Of  hail, thou
Whose Streams, from every Quarter confluent, form
MY  that nurses human Life.
By Rills from Thee deduc'd, irriguous, fed,
The  looks gay, with  Wealth
Abundant flows, and blooms with each Delight
That  craves. It's happy Master there,
The ONLY FREE-MAN, walks his pleasing Round:
Sweet-featur'd  attending; fearless ;
Firm ;  blessing all
That can rejoice;  surest Friend;
And, still fresh Stores from  Book deriv'd,
Companion ever-new.
These chear his rural, and sustain or fire,
When into Action call'd, his busy Hours.
Mean time
and  combin'd, direct
His clear Affairs, and from
Secure his little Kingdom. Nor can Those
Whom  heaps, without  reach
That Truce with Pain, that animated Ease,
That Self-Enjoyment springing from within,
That INDEPENDANCE, active, or retir'd,
Which make the soundest Bliss of Man below:
But, lost beneath the Rubbish of their Means,
And drain'd by Wants to  all unknown,
A wandering, tasteless, gaily-wretched Train,
Tho' rich, are Beggars, and, tho' noble, Slaves.

Mean time
and  combin'd, direct
His clear Affairs, and from
Secure his little Kingdom. Nor can Those
Whom  heaps, without  reach
That Truce with Pain, that animated Ease,
That Self-Enjoyment springing from within,

lines.line_text: Lo! damn'd to Wealth, at what a gross Expence,
They purchase Disappointment, Pain and Shame.
Instead of hearty hospitable Chear,
See! how the Hall with brutal Riot flows;
While in the foaming Flood, fermenting, steep'd,
The Country maddens into Party-Rage.
Mark! those disgraceful Piles of Wood and Stone;
Those Parks and Gardens, where, his Haunts be-trimm'd,
And  by presumptuous  oppress'd,
The  mourns. See! the full Board
That steams Disgust, and Bowls that give no Joy:
No  invited there, to feed the Mind;
Nor  the Wine rejoicing Reason quaffs.
Hark! how the Dome with Insolence resounds,
With those retain'd by  to scare
Repose and Friends. To tyrant  mark!
The costly-Worship paid, to the broad Gaze
Of Fools. From still delusive Day to Day,
Led an eternal Round of lying Hope,
See! self-abandon'd, how they roam adrift,
Dash'd o'er the Town, a miserable Wreck!
Then to adore some warbling Eunuch turn'd,
With  'Ears they crowd; or to the Buzz
Of Masquerade unblushing: or, to show
Their Scorn of  at the Tragic Scene
They mirthful sit, or prove the Comic true.
But, chief, behold! around the rattling Board,
The civil Robbers rang'd; and even the Fair,
The tender Fair, each Sweetness laid aside,
As fierce for Plunder as all-licens'd' Troops
At some sack'd City. Thus dissolv'd their Wealth,
Without one generous Luxury dissolv'd,
Or quarter'd on it many a needless Want,
At the throng'd Leve bends the venal Tribe:
With fair but faithless Smiles each varnish'd o'er,
Each smooth as Those that mutually deceive,
And for their Falshood each despising each;
'Till shook their Patron by the wintry Winds,
Wide flies the wither'd Shower, and leaves him bare.
O far superior  sable Sons,
By Merchant pilfer'd, to these !
And, rich, as unsqueez'd Favourite, to them,
Is he who can his  boast alone!

lines.line_text: BRITONS! be firm! — nor let  sly
Twine round your Heart indissoluble Chains!
The Steel of BRUTUS burst the grosser Bonds
By  cast o'er ROME; but still remain'd
The soft enchanting Fetters of the Mind,
And  rose.  hold
Your INDEPENDANCE; for,  once destroy'd.
Unfounded, FREEDOM is a Morning Dream,
That flits aerial from the spreading Eye.

stanzas.stanza_text:
BRITONS! be firm! — nor let  sly
Twine round your Heart indissoluble Chains!
The Steel of BRUTUS burst the grosser Bonds
By  cast o'er ROME; but still remain'd
The soft enchanting Fetters of the Mind,
And  rose.  hold
Your INDEPENDANCE; for,  once destroy'd.
Unfounded, FREEDOM is a Morning Dream,
That flits aerial from the spreading Eye.

lines.line_text: Forbid it HEAVEN! that ever I need urge
INTEGRITY IN OFFICE on MY Sons;
Inculcate common Honour — not to rob. —
And whom? — the gracious the confiding Hand,
That lavishly rewards; the toiling Poor,
Whose Cup with many a bitter Drop is mixt;
The Guardian Publick; every Face they see,
And every Friend; nay, in Effect, themselves.
As, in familiar Life, the Villain's Fate
Admits no Cure; so, when a desperate Age
At  arrives, I the devoted Race
Indignant spurn, and hopeless soar away.

stanzas.stanza_text:

And every Friend; nay, in Effect, themselves.
As, in familiar Life, the Villain's Fate
Admits no Cure; so, when a desperate Age
At  arrives, I the devoted Race
Indignant spurn, and hopeless soar away.

lines.line_text: But, ah too little known to modern Times!
Be not the noblest Passion past unsung;
That Ray peculiar, from UNBOUNDED LOVE
Effus'd, which kindles the heroic Soul;
DEVOTION TO THE PUBLIC. Glorious Flame!
Celestial Ardor! in what unknown Worlds,
Profusely scatter'd thro' the blue Immense,
Hast  been blessing Myriads, since in ROME,
Old virtuous ROME, so many deathless Names
From  their Lustre drew? since, taught by
Their Poverty put Splendor to the Blush,
Pain grew luxurious, and even Death Delight?
O wilt  ne'er, in  long Period, look,
With Blaze direct, on this MY

lines.line_text: 'Tis not enough, from  right understood
Reflected, that  Rays inflame the Heart:
Tho' VIRTUE not disdains Appeals to
Dreads not the Trial; all her Joys are true,
Nor is there any real Joy save Her's.
Far less the tepid the declaiming Race,
Foes to  to it's Wages Friends,
Or those whom private Passions, for a while,
Beneath MY Standard list, can  suffice
To raise and fix the Glory of MY REIGN?

Tho' VIRTUE not disdains Appeals to

Nor is there any real Joy save Her's.
Far less the tepid the declaiming Race,

Beneath MY Standard list, can  suffice

lines.line_text: An active Flood of
Must swell the Breast. First, in Effusion wide,
The restless Spirit roves Creation round,
And seizes  Stronger then
It tends to  whate'er the kindred Search
Of Bliss allys: then, more collected still,
It urges  a Passion grown,,
At last, the central  calls
It's utmost Effort forth, awakes each Sense,
The Comely, Grand and Tender. Without This,
This awful Pant, shook from sublimer Powers
Than those of  this HEAVEN-infus'd Delight,
This  rushing prone
To press the  MY System soon,
Traverse, to several  Centers drawn,
Will reel to Ruin: while for ever shut
Stand the bright Portals of desponding

lines.line_text: From  shoot up no shining Deeds,
None of those ancient Lights, that gladden Earth,
Give Grace to Being, and arrouse the Brave
To  VIRTUE's quickening Fire!
Life tedious grows, an idly-bustling Round,
Fill'd up with Actions animal and mean,
A dull Gazette! Th' impatient Reader scorns
The poor historic Page; 'till kindly comes
Oblivion, and redeems a People's Shame.
Not so the Times when, Emulation-stung,
GREECE shone in  and in
And ROME in  dreadful to be told!
To live was Glory  and charm'd Mankind,
Thro' the deep Periods of devolving Time,
raptur'd, copy;  astonish'd, read.

stanzas.stanza_text:
From  shoot up no shining Deeds,
None of those ancient Lights, that gladden Earth,
Give Grace to Being, and arrouse the Brave
To  VIRTUE's quickening Fire!
Life tedious grows, an idly-bustling Round,
Fill'd up with Actions animal and mean,
A dull Gazette! Th' impatient Reader scorns
The poor historic Page; 'till kindly comes
Oblivion, and redeems a People's Shame.
Not so the Times when, Emulation-stung,
GREECE shone in  and in

To live was Glory  and charm'd Mankind,
Thro' the deep Periods of devolving Time,
raptur'd, copy;  astonish'd, read.

lines.line_text: True, a  with every Vice
And every Meanness foul,  damps.
Who can, unshock'd, behold the cruel Eye?
The pale inveigling Smile? The ruffian Front?
The Wretch abandon'd to relentless Self,
Equally vile if Miser or Profuse?
Powers not of GOD, assiduous to
The fell deputed Tyrant, who devours
The Poor and Weak, at Distance from Redress?
Delirious Faction bellowing loud MY Name?
The false fair-seeming Patriot's hollow Boast?
A Race resolv'd on Bondage, fierce for Chains,
MY sacred Rights a Merchandize alone
Esteeming, and to work their Feeder's Will
By Deeds, a Horror to Mankind, prepar'd,
As were the  of old?
Who  indeed can undetesting see? —
But who unpitying? To the generous Eye
is ; and, tho' Self-betray'd,
A People struggling with their Fate must rouze
The Hero's Throb. Nor can a Land, at once,
Be lost to  quite. How glorious then!
Fit Luxury for Gods! to save the Good,
Protect the Feeble, dash bold Vice aside,
Depress the Wicked, and restore the Frail.
Posterity, besides, the Young are pure,
And Sons may tinge their Father's Cheek with Shame.

stanzas.stanza_text:
True, a  with every Vice
And every Meanness foul,  damps.
Who can, unshock'd, behold the cruel Eye?
The pale inveigling Smile? The ruffian Front?
The Wretch abandon'd to relentless Self,
Equally vile if Miser or Profuse?
Powers not of GOD, assiduous to
The fell deputed Tyrant, who devours
The Poor and Weak, at Distance from Redress?
Delirious Faction bellowing loud MY Name?
The false fair-seeming Patriot's hollow Boast?
A Race resolv'd on Bondage, fierce for Chains,
MY sacred Rights a Merchandize alone
Esteeming, and to work their Feeder's Will
By Deeds, a Horror to Mankind, prepar'd,
As were the  of old?
Who  indeed can undetesting see? —
But who unpitying? To the generous Eye
is ; and, tho' Self-betray'd,
A People struggling with their Fate must rouze
The Hero's Throb. Nor can a Land, at once,
Be lost to  quite. How glorious then!
Fit Luxury for Gods! to save the Good,
Protect the Feeble, dash bold Vice aside,
Depress the Wicked, and restore the Frail.
Posterity, besides, the Young are pure,
And Sons may tinge their Father's Cheek with Shame.

lines.line_text: Should then the Times arrive (which HEAVEN avert!)
That BRITONS bend unnerv'd, not by the Force
Of Arms, more generous, and more manly, quell'd,
But by  Soul-dejecting Arts,
Arts impudent! and gross! by  Gold,
bestow'd, to  them to give
With  raging, or immers'd in
Should they BRITANNIA's well-fought Laurels yield
To ; even from her Brow
Let  be basely torn,
By such as tremble at the stiffening Gale,
And nerveless sink while others sing rejoic'd.
Or (darker Prospect! scarce one Gleam behind
Disclosing) should the broad
Breathe from the City to the farthest Hut,
That sits serene within the Forest-Shade;
The sever'd People fire, inflame their Wants,
And their luxurious Thirst, so gathering Rage,
That, were a Buyer found, they stand
To sell their Birthright for a cooling Draught.
Should  for  plead;
The hir'd Assassins of the Commonweal!
Deem'd the declaiming Rant of GREECE and ROME,
Should  grow the
'Till  failing,  thro' the Land:
'Till round the City loose
Dire-prowling nightly, makes the chearful Haunts
Of Men more hideous than  Wilds,
Nor from it's Fury sleeps the Vale in Peace;
And  abound:
Nay, 'till to lowest Deeds the Highest stoop;
The Rich, like starving Wretches, thirst for Gold;
And those, on whom the vernal Showers of HEAVEN
All-bounteous fall, and that  bestow,
A Power to live to  and
In sick Attendance wear their anxious Days,
With Fortune, joyless, and, with Honours, mean.
Meantime, perhaps,  flows around,
The  without the ;
No Mark of Millions in the Gulph absorpt
Of  none but the Rage
Of  still demanding
That very Portion, which (by faithful Skill
Employ'd) might make the smiling Public rear
Her ornamented Head, drill'd thro' the Hands
Of  serves but to nurse
A Locust-Band within, and in the Bud
Leaves starv'd each Work of Dignity and Use.

lines.line_text: I paint the worst. But should these Times arrive,
If any  yet remain,
Let all MY  all  fling aside,
Despise their  and together join;
Let  and  scorning low Despair,
Exerted full, from every Quarter shine,
Commix'd in heighten'd Blaze. Light flash'd to Light,
Moral, or Intellectual, more intense
By giving glows. As on pure Winter's Eve,
Gradual, the Stars effulge; fainter, at first,
They, straggling, rise; but when the radiant Host,
In thick Profusion pour'd, shine out immense,
Each casting vivid Influence on each,
From Pole to Pole a glittering Deluge plays,
And Worlds above rejoice, and Men below.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I paint the worst. But should these Times arrive,
If any  yet remain,
Let all MY  all  fling aside,
Despise their  and together join;
Let  and  scorning low Despair,
Exerted full, from every Quarter shine,
Commix'd in heighten'd Blaze. Light flash'd to Light,
Moral, or Intellectual, more intense
By giving glows. As on pure Winter's Eve,
Gradual, the Stars effulge; fainter, at first,
They, straggling, rise; but when the radiant Host,
In thick Profusion pour'd, shine out immense,
Each casting vivid Influence on each,
From Pole to Pole a glittering Deluge plays,
And Worlds above rejoice, and Men below.

lines.line_text: But why to BRITONS this superfluous Strain? —
Good-nature, honest Truth even somewhat blunt,
Of crooked Baseness an indignant Scorn,
A Zeal unyielding in their Country's Cause,
And ready Bounty, wont to dwell with them. —
Nor only wont — Wide o'er the Land diffus'd,
In many a blest Retirement still they dwell.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But why to BRITONS this superfluous Strain? —
Good-nature, honest Truth even somewhat blunt,
Of crooked Baseness an indignant Scorn,
A Zeal unyielding in their Country's Cause,
And ready Bounty, wont to dwell with them. —
Nor only wont — Wide o'er the Land diffus'd,
In many a blest Retirement still they dwell.

lines.line_text: To softer Prospect turn we now the View,
To laurel'd SCIENCE, ARTS, and PUBLIC WORKS,
That lend MY FINISH'D FABRIC comely Pride,
Grandeur and Grace. Of sullen Genius he!
Curs'd by the  by the  loath'd!
Who deems beneath the Public's high Regard
MY
However puff'd with Power, and gorg'd with Wealth,
A Nation be; let Trade enormous rise,
Let  and  their mingled Treasure pour,
'Till, swell'd impetuous, the
Burst o'er the City and devour the Land:
Yet  neglected,
Wealth rots, a Nusance; and, oblivious, sunk,
must  lie.
If not by  on monumental Brass,
On sculptur'd Marble, or the deathless Page
Imprest, Renown had left no Trace behind:
In vain, to future Times, the Sage had thought,
The Legislator plann'd, the Hero found
A beauteous Death, the Patriot toil'd in vain.
Th' Awarders  of  immortal Wreathe,
rouze Ambition,  the Mind exalt,
Give great Ideas, lovely Forms infuse,
Delight the general Eye, and, drest by
The  glows with double Charms.

lines.line_text: SCIENCE, MY close Associate, still attends
Where-e'er I go. Sometimes, in simple Guise,
walks the Furrow with the
Whispering unletter'd Wisdom to the Heart,
Direct; or, sometimes, in the pompous Robe
Of  drest,  charms
And a whole sapient City round  burns.
Then o'er  Brow MINERVA'S Terrors nod:
With XENOPHON, sometimes, in dire Extremes,
breathes deliberate Soul, and makes
Unequal'd Glory: with the  Sage,
EPAMINONDAS,  and  of Men!
Sometimes  bids the deep-embattled Host,
Above the vulgar Reach, resistless form'd,
March to sure Conquest, — never gain'd before!
Nor on the treacherous Seas of giddy State
Unskilful  when the triumphant Tide
Of high-swoln  wears one boundless Smile,
And the Gale tempts to new Pursuits of Fame,
Sometimes, with SCIPIO,  collects her Sail,
And seeks the blissful Shore of rural Ease,
Where, but th'  no  sing.
Or should the deep-brew'd Tempest muttering rise,
While Rocks and Shoals perfidious lurk around,
With TULLY  her wide-reviving Light
To  holds, a  confounds,
And saves awhile from  sinking ROME.
Such the kind POWER, whose piercing Eye dissolves
Each  and sets  free;
For ME inspiring an  Zeal,
The more tenacious as the more convinc'd
How happy  and how wretched
To BRITONS not unknown, to BRITONS full
The GODDESS spreads her Stores, the secret Soul
That quickens Trade, the Breath unseen that wafts
To them the Treasures of a  World.
But FINER ARTS (save what the MUSE has sung,
In daring Flight, above all modern Wing)
Neglected droop the Head; and PUBLIC WORKS,
Broke by  into
Not ornament, disgrace, not serve, destroy.

lines.line_text: Shall BRITONS, by their own JOINT WISDOM rul'd
Beneath one ROYAL HEAD, whose vital Power
Connects, enlivens and exerts the WHOLE;
In FINER ARTS, and PUBLIC WORKS, shall
To  yield? — yield to a Land that bends,
Deprest, and broke, beneath the Will of
Of  — who, should th' unkingly Thirst of Gold,
Or tyrant Passions, or Ambition, prompt,
Calls  o'er the blasted Land:
Drains from it's thirsty Bounds the Springs of Wealth,
His own insatiate Reservoir to fill:
To the lone Desart  frowns,
Or into Dungeons  when They, their Chains,
Indignant, bursting, for their
All other  scorn but TRUTH's and MINE.
Oh shame to think! shall BRITONS, in the Field
Unconquer'd still, the  lose?
Even in   Reign, who vainly dreamt,
By giddy Power, betray'd, and flatter'd Pride,
To grasp ; while, swarming round,
His Armies dar'd all  to the Field;
To hostile Hands while Treasure flow'd profuse,
And, that great Source of Treasure, Subjects 'Blood,
Inhuman squander'd, sicken'd every Land;
From BRITAIN, chief, while MY
In Vengeance rushing, dash'd his idle Hopes,
And bad his agonizing Heart be low:
Even  as in the golden Calm of Peace,
What PUBLIC WORKS, at home, what ARTS arose!
What various SCIENCE shone! what GENIUS glow'd!

In FINER ARTS, and PUBLIC WORKS, shall
To  yield? — yield to a Land that bends,
Deprest, and broke, beneath the Will of
Of  — who, should th' unkingly Thirst of Gold,
Or tyrant Passions, or Ambition, prompt,
Calls  o'er the blasted Land:
Drains from it's thirsty Bounds the Springs of Wealth,
His own insatiate Reservoir to fill:
To the lone Desart  frowns,
Or into Dungeons  when They, their Chains,
Indignant, bursting, for their
All other  scorn but TRUTH's and MINE.
Oh shame to think! shall BRITONS, in the Field
Unconquer'd still, the  lose?
Even in   Reign, who vainly dreamt,
By giddy Power, betray'd, and flatter'd Pride,
To grasp ; while, swarming round,
His Armies dar'd all  to the Field;
To hostile Hands while Treasure flow'd profuse,

From BRITAIN, chief, while MY
In Vengeance rushing, dash'd his idle Hopes,

lines.line_text: 'Tis not for ME to paint, diffusive shot
O'er fair Extents of Land, the shining Road;
The Flood-compelling Arch; the long Canal,
Thro' Mountains piercing, and uniting Seas;
The Dome resounding sweet with Infant Joy,
From Famine sav'd, or cruel-handed Shame,
And  where  counts his noble Scars;
The Land where  loves to dwell,
Of the fierce  freed;
The Robber from his farthest Forest chas'd;
The turbid City clear'd, and, by Degrees,
Into sure Peace the best Police refin'd,
Magnificence, and Grace, and decent Joy.
Let  Bards record, how honour'd ARTS,
And SCIENCE, by despotic Bounty bless'd,
At Distance flourish'd from MY PARENT-EYE.
Restoring ancient Taste, how BOILEAU rose.
How the big ROMAN Soul shook, in CORNEILLE,
The trembling Stage. In elegant RACINE,
How the more powerful tho' more humble Voice
Of Nature-painting GREECE, resistless, breath'd
The whole awaken'd Heart. How MOLIERE's Scene,
Chastis'd and regular, with well-judg'd Wit,
Not scatter'd wild, and native Humour, grac'd,
Was Life itself. To public Honours rais'd,
How Learning in warm Seminaries spread;
And, more for Glory than the small Reward,
How Emulation strove. How their pure Tongue
Almost obtain'd what was deny'd their Arms.
From  awhile, how PAINTING, courted long,
With POUSSIN came;  that lifts
A fairer Front, and looks another Soul.
How the kind  that, of unvalu'd Price,
The fam'd and  Picture, easy, gives,
Refin'd her Touch, and, thro' the shadow'd Piece,
All the live Spirit of the Painter pour'd.
Coyest of  how  northward deign'd
A Look, and bad her GIRARDON arise.
How  blaz'd; the barren Waste,
Astonish'd, saw the sudden Palace swell,
And Fountains spout amid it's arid Shades.
For Leagues, bright Vistas opening to the View,
How Forests in majestic Gardens smil'd.
How  by their  taught,
Wove the deep Flower, the blooming Foliage train'd
In joyous Figures o'er the silky Lawn,
The Palace chear'd, illum'd the Story'd Wall,
And with the Pencil vy'd the glowing Loom.

lines.line_text: These Laurels, LOUIS, by the Droppings rais'd
Of thy Profusion, it's Dishonour shade,
And, green thro' future Times, shall bind thy Brow;
While the vain Honours of perfidious War
Wither abhorr'd, or in Oblivion lost.
With what prevailing Vigour had they shot,
And stole a deeper Root, by the full Tide
Of War-sunk Millions fed? Superior still,
How had they branch'd luxuriant to the Skies,
In BRITAIN planted, by the potent Juice
Of  swell'd? Forc'd is the Bloom of ARTS,
A false uncertain Spring, when  gives,
Weak without ME, a transitory Gleam.
Fair shine the slippery Days, enticing Skies
Of Favour smile, and courtly Breezes blow;
'Till ARTS, betray'd, trust to the flattering Air
Their tender Blossom: — then malignant rise
The Blights of  of those Insect-Clouds,
That, blasting  often cover
Nay, should, perchance, some kind MOECENAS aid
The doubtful Beamings of his PRINCE's Soul,
His wavering Ardor fix, and unconfin'd
Diffuse his warm Beneficence around;
Yet Death, at last, and wintry Tyrants come,
Each Sprig of  killing at the Root.
But when with ME IMPERIAL BOUNTY joins,
Wide o'er the Public blows eternal Spring;
While mingled Autumn every Harvest pours
Of every Land; whate'er
and  can produce.

and  can produce.

lines.line_text: Here ceas'd the GODDESS; and HER ardent Wings,
Dipt in the Colours of the heavenly Bow,
Stood waving Radiance round, for sudden Flight
Prepar'd, when thus, impatient, burst my Prayer.
"Oh forming Light of Life! Oh better Sun!
" Sun of Mankind! by whom the cloudy
"Sublim'd, not envies  Skies,
" That, unstain'd Ether all, diffusive smile:
"  THY WORK  " Strait with HER Hand,
Celestial red, SHE touch'd my darken'd Eyes.
As at the Touch of Day the Shades dissolve,
So quick, methought, the misty Circle clear'd,
That dims the Dawn of Being here below:
The Future shone disclos'd, and, in long View,
Bright rising Aeras instant rush'd to Light.

stanzas.stanza_text:

"Sublim'd, not envies  Skies,
" That, unstain'd Ether all, diffusive smile:
"
"  THY WORK  " Strait with HER Hand,
Celestial red, SHE touch'd my darken'd Eyes.
As at the Touch of Day the Shades dissolve,
So quick, methought, the misty Circle clear'd,
That dims the Dawn of Being here below:
The Future shone disclos'd, and, in long View,
Bright rising Aeras instant rush'd to Light.

lines.line_text: "THEY come! GREAT GODDESS! I the TIMES behold!
" The TIMES our Fathers, in the bloody Field,
"Have earn'd so dear, and, not with less Renown,
" In the warm Struggles of the Senate-Fight.
"The TIMES I see! whose Glory to supply,
" For toiling Ages,  round the World
"Has wing'd unnumber'd Sails, and from each Land
" Materials heap'd, that, well-employ'd, with ROME
"Might vie our  and with GREECE our

stanzas.stanza_text:
"THEY come! GREAT GODDESS! I the TIMES behold!
" The TIMES our Fathers, in the bloody Field,
"Have earn'd so dear, and, not with less Renown,
" In the warm Struggles of the Senate-Fight.
"The TIMES I see! whose Glory to supply,
" For toiling Ages,  round the World
"Has wing'd unnumber'd Sails, and from each Land
" Materials heap'd, that, well-employ'd, with ROME
"Might vie our  and with GREECE our

lines.line_text: "Lo! PRINCES I behold! contriving still,
" And still conducting firm some brave Design;
"KINGS! that the narrow joyless Circle scorn,
" Burst the Blockade of false designing Men,
"Of treacherous Smiles, of Adulation fell,
" And of the blinding Clouds around them thrown:
"Their Court rejoicing Millions;  alone,
" And  dear to them; their best Delight,
"In just Proportion, to give general Joy;
" Their jealous Care THY KINGDOM to maintain;
"The public Glory Theirs; unsparing Love
" Their endless Treasure; and their Deeds their Praise.
"With THEE They work. Nought can resist YOUR Force:
"  feels it quickening in her dark Retreats:
"Strong spread the Blooms of ;
" His bashful Bounds disclosing  breaks;
"And, big with Fruits of  blows
" Expansive o'er the Land. Another Race
"Of GENEROUS YOUTH, of PATRIOT-SIRES, I see!
" Not those vain Insects fluttering in the Blaze
"Of Court and Ball and Play; those venal Souls,
"  veteran unrelenting Bands,
"That, to their Vices Slaves, can ne'er be free.

stanzas.stanza_text:

"Of treacherous Smiles, of Adulation fell,
" And of the blinding Clouds around them thrown:
"Their Court rejoicing Millions;  alone,
" And  dear to them; their best Delight,
"In just Proportion, to give general Joy;
" Their jealous Care THY KINGDOM to maintain;
"The public Glory Theirs; unsparing Love
" Their endless Treasure; and their Deeds their Praise.
"With THEE They work. Nought can resist YOUR Force:
"  feels it quickening in her dark Retreats:
"Strong spread the Blooms of ;
" His bashful Bounds disclosing  breaks;
"And, big with Fruits of  blows
" Expansive o'er the Land. Another Race
"Of GENEROUS YOUTH, of PATRIOT-SIRES, I see!
" Not those vain Insects fluttering in the Blaze
"Of Court and Ball and Play; those venal Souls,
"  veteran unrelenting Bands,
"That, to their Vices Slaves, can ne'er be free.

lines.line_text: "I see the FOUNTAIN's purg'd! whence Life derives
" A clear or turbid Flow; see the young Mind.
"Not fed impure by Chance, by Flattery fool'd,
" Or by scholastic Jargon bloated proud,
"But fill'd and nourish'd by the Light of Truth.
" Then beam'd thro' Fancy the refining Ray,
"And pouring on the Heart, the Passions feel
" At once informing Light and moving Flame;
'"Till moral, public, graceful Action crowns
" The Whole. Behold! the fair Contention glows,
"In all that Mind or Body can adorn,
" And form to Life. Instead of barren Heads,
"Barbarian Pedants, wrangling Sons of Pride,
" And Truth-perplexing metaphysic Wits,
"Men, Patriots, Chiefs and Citizens are form'd.

" Then beam'd thro' Fancy the refining Ray,

" At once informing Light and moving Flame;

"Barbarian Pedants, wrangling Sons of Pride,
" And Truth-perplexing metaphysic Wits,
"Men, Patriots, Chiefs and Citizens are form'd.

lines.line_text: "Lo! JUSTICE, like the liberal Light of Heaven,
"  shines on All, and from her Beam,
"Appalling Guilt, retire the savage Crew,
" That prowl amid the Darkness they themselves
"Have thrown around the Laws.  grieves,
" See! how her  bite the Lip,
"While YORKS and TALBOTS their deep Snares detect,
" And seize swift Justice thro' the Clouds they raise.

" That prowl amid the Darkness they themselves

lines.line_text: "See! social LABOUR lifts his  Head,
" And Men not yield to Government in vain.
"From the  Land is rooted ruffian Force,
" And, the lewd Nurse of Villains, idle Waste;
"Lo! raz'd their Haunts, down dash'd their maddening Bowl,
" A Nation's Poison! Beauteous Order reigns!
"Manly Submission, unimposing Toil,
" Trade without Guile, Civility that marks
"From the foul Herd of brutal Slaves THY Sons,
" And fearless Peace. Or should affronting War
"To slow but dreadful Vengeance rouse the Just,
" Unfailing  of  I behold!
"That know, with their own proper Arm, to guard
" Their own blest Isle against a leaguing World.
"Despairing  her boiling Youth restrains,
" Dissolv'd her Dream of
"The Winds and Seas are BRITAIN's wide Domain;
" And not a Sail, but by Permission, spreads.

"The Winds and Seas are BRITAIN's wide Domain;

lines.line_text: "Lo! swarming southward on rejoicing Suns,
" Gay COLONIES extend; the calm Retreat
"Of undeserv'd Distress, the better Home
" Of Those whom  chase from foreign Lands.
"Not built on  and
" And, in their turn, some petty Tyrant's Prey;
"But, bound by  firm they rise;
" Such as, of late, an OGLETHORPE has form'd,
"And, crowding round, the charm'd  fees.

"Lo! swarming southward on rejoicing Suns,
" Gay COLONIES extend; the calm Retreat
"Of undeserv'd Distress, the better Home
" Of Those whom  chase from foreign Lands.
"Not built on  and
" And, in their turn, some petty Tyrant's Prey;
"But, bound by  firm they rise;
" Such as, of late, an OGLETHORPE has form'd,
"And, crowding round, the charm'd  fees.

lines.line_text: "Horrid with Want and Misery, no more
" Our Streets the tender Passenger afflict.
"Nor shivering Age, nor Sickness without Friend,
" Or Home, or Bed to bear his burning Load,
"Nor agonizing Infant, that ne'er earn'd
" It's guiltless Pangs, I see! The Stores, profuse,
"Which  has to These assign'd,
" No more the sacrilegious Riot swell
"Of Cannibal Devourers! Right apply'd,
" No starving Wretch the Land of  stains:
"If poor, Employment finds; if old demands,
" If sick, if maim'd, his miserable Due;
"And will, if young, repay the fondest Care.
" Sweet sets the Sun of stormy Life, and sweet
"The Morning shines, in  Dews array'd.
" Lo! how they rise! THESE FAMILIES OF HEAVEN!
"  chief, (but why — ye  — why so late?)
"Where blooms and warbles glad a rising Age:
" What Smiles of Praise! And, while their Song ascends,
"The listening Seraph lays his Lute aside.

lines.line_text: "Hark! the gay MUSES raise a nobler Strain,
" With active Nature, warm impassion'd Truth,
"Engaging Fable, lucid Order, Notes
" Of various String, and heart-felt Image fill'd.
"Behold! I see the dread delightful
" Of  and of
"Restor'd: behold! the well-dissembled Scene
" Calls from embellish'd Eyes the lovely Tear,
"Or lights up Mirth in modest Cheeks again.
" Lo! vanish'd Lo! driven away
"Those that  sacred Walks profane:
" Their wild Creation scatter'd, where a World
"Unknown to  Chaos more confus'd,
" O'er the brute Scene it's  pours;
"Detested Forms! that, on the Mind imprest,
" Corrupt, confound and barbarize an Age.

lines.line_text: "Behold! all  the SISTER-ARTS,
" Thy  They, knit in harmonious Dance.
"Nurs'd by the Treasure, from a Nation drain'd
" Their Works to purchase, They to Nobler rouze
"Their untam'd Genius, their unfetter'd Thought;
" Of pompous Tyrants, and of dreaming Monks,
"The gaudy Tools, and Prisoners, no more.

"The  breathing a religious Awe;
" Even fram'd with Elegance the

lines.line_text: "See! SYLVAN SCENES, where  alone, pretends
" To dress her Mistress, and disclose her Charms:
"Such as a POPE in Miniature has shown;
" A BATHURST o'er the widening Forest spreads;
"And such as form a RICHMOND, CHISWICK, STOWE.
"August, around, what PUBLIC WORKS I see!
" Lo! stately  lo!  that court the Breeze.
"In spite of Those to whom pertains the Care,
" Ingulphing more than founded
"Lo! ray'd from Cities o'er the brighten'd Land,
" Connecting Sea to Sea, the Solid
"Lo! the Proud  (no vile Exactor's Stand)
" With easy Sweep bestrides the chafing Flood.
"See! long  and  join
" Each Part with each, and with the circling Main
"The whole enliven'd Isle. Lo!  expand,
" Free as the Winds and Waves, their sheltering Arms.
"Lo! streaming Comfort o'er the troubled Deep,
" On every pointed Coast the  tow'rs;
"And, by the broad imperious  repell'd,
" Hark! how the baffled Storm indignant roars. "

lines.line_text: As thick to View THESE VARIED WONDERS rose,
Shook all my Soul with Transport, unassur'd,
The VISION broke; And, on my waking Eye,
Rush'd the still RUINS of dejected ROME.

stanzas.stanza_text:
As thick to View THESE VARIED WONDERS rose,
Shook all my Soul with Transport, unassur'd,
The VISION broke; And, on my waking Eye,
Rush'd the still RUINS of dejected ROME.
